title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
content: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
intro: A classic novel exploring the nuances of early 19th century English society.
comment: This timeless novel offers keen insights into love and social standing, still relevant today.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
content: Call me Ishmael. Some years ago—never mind how long precisely—having little or no money in my purse...
intro: An epic tale of a man's obsession with conquering the great white whale.
comment: Melville's work is a profound exploration of man's struggle against nature and fate.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
content: To Sherlock Holmes she is always the woman. I have seldom heard him mention her under any other name.
intro: A collection of fascinating mysteries solved by the legendary detective.
comment: Doyle's detective stories are masterpieces in logical reasoning and suspense.

title: The Raven
author: Edgar Allan Poe
content: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary, Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore...
intro: A narrative poem of a mysterious raven's visit to a grieving lover.
comment: Poe's 'The Raven' delves into themes of despair and longing with haunting rhythm.

title: Walden
author: Henry David Thoreau
content: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life...
intro: An exploration of living a life close to nature.
comment: Thoreau's Walden is a reflection on simple living in natural surroundings, inspiring mindfulness.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
content: My father's family name being Pirrip, and my Christian name Philip, my infant tongue could make of both names nothing longer or more explicit than Pip.
intro: A young boy's journey from boyhood to maturity.
comment: Dickens' Great Expectations combines rich narrative and memorable characters, exploring life's moral complexities.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
content: 3 May. Bistritz.—Left Munich at 8:35 P.M., on 1st May, arriving at Vienna early next morning...
intro: A classic horror story introducing the legendary Count Dracula.
comment: Bram Stoker's Dracula is a masterpiece of horror, blending myth and reality.

title: Leaves of Grass
author: Walt Whitman
content: I celebrate myself, and sing myself, And what I assume you shall assume, For every atom belonging to me as good belongs to you.
intro: A groundbreaking collection of poems celebrating humanity and nature.
comment: Whitman's Leaves of Grass is a celebration of the human spirit and nature's beauty.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
content: The studio was filled with the rich odor of roses, and when the light summer wind stirred amidst the trees of the garden...
intro: A tale of beauty, youth, and a soul's corruption.
comment: Wilde's work is a compelling exploration of vanity, morality, and the human soul.

title: The Canterbury Tales
author: Geoffrey Chaucer
content: Whan that Aprille with his shoures soote, The droghte of March hath perced to the roote...
intro: A collection of stories told by pilgrims on their way to Canterbury.
comment: Chaucer's tales offer a vibrant and insightful glimpse into medieval English society.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
content: Happy families are all alike; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
intro: A profound exploration of love and infidelity set against the backdrop of Russian high society.
comment: Tolstoy's masterpiece intricately weaves human emotions with social norms, questioning the essence of happiness.

title: Anna Karenina3
author: Leo Tolstoy
content: Happy families are all alike; every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
intro: A profound exploration of love and infidelity set against the backdrop of Russian high society.
comment: Tolstoy's masterpiece intricately weaves human emotions with social norms, questioning the essence of happiness.
